lessons.title: Lesson 1: A Brief History of Geometry

games.name: Geometry Timeline
games.implementationDetails: Present historical figures (Euclid, Thales, Pythagoras) and civilizations (Egypt, Babylonia, Greece). Drag-and-drop or a card sorting interface to place them on a timeline. Check chronological order and provide informative feedback.

games.name: Civilization comparison
games.implementationDetails: Present multiple choice question like where this construction method used?

lessons.title: Lesson 2: Euclid's Definitions for Point, Line, and Surface

games.name: Definition Match
games.implementationDetails: Display Euclid's definitions for point, line, and surface (some scrambled or incomplete). Ask the player to match the correct definitions. Use a drag-and-drop or card matching interface. Give feedback.

games.name: Definition component arrangement
games.implementationDetails: Divide definitions into parts and ask to arrange correctly

games.name: Which definition?
games.implementationDetails: Present figures and which definition applied here

lessons.title: Lesson 3: The Concept of Undefined Terms in Geometry

games.name: Undefined Term Identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present sentences using geometrical terms (point, line, plane, breadth, length) and ask what needs further definition?

games.name: Definition cycle
games.implementationDetails: Show an infinitely cycling set of definitions and ask to identify base point

games.name: Axiom Application
games.implementationDetails: Present geometric scenarios. Select best application axiom

games.name: Axiom definer
games.implementationDetails: Put statements multiple choice what it represents

lessons.title: Lesson 5: Euclid's Postulate 1: A Unique Line Through Two Points

games.name: Point Linker
games.implementationDetails: Present line and ask to draw number using postulates and axioms

games.name: Unique identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present different number of points which can be join and a ask how many joins posible for point

lessons.title: Lesson 6: Euclid's Postulate 2: Extending a Terminated Line

games.name: Line Extender
games.implementationDetails: Present line and put slider where can student move and see
learningPoints: Understanding Postulate of line can extend

games.name: End state identifier
games.implementationDetails: Present diagrams of line extension and ask end result or vice versa

lessons.title: Lesson 7: Euclid's Postulate 3: Drawing a Circle

games.implementationDetails: Set a number line value and draw circle and change raidus

lessons.title: Lesson 8: Euclid's Postulate 4: Equality of Right Angles

games.name: Right angle visual recognizer
games.implementationDetails: Present different angle with different scale ask which one look right angle

games.name: Equal check
games.implementationDetails: Present right angle and equal angle figure and tell if they are same or not

games.name: Parallel liner
games.implementationDetails: A line intersects two line what side angle low sum than 180

games.name: Postulate finder
